snippet: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.
abstract: Kenya's Pres Uhuru Kenyatta blames domestic foes, not Somali extremist group Shabab, for attack in Lamu that left at least 57 people dead; Shabab claimed responsibility for attack, but Kenyatta says evidence points to local political networks; some analysts question Kenyatta's effort to shift blame as political ploy.

byline.original: By ISMA'IL KUSHKUSH and DAN BILEFSKY
byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush reported from Nairobi, and Dan Bilefsky from Paris.

lead_paragraph: President Uhuru Kenyatta said the killing of at least 57 people in two raids was the work of local “political networks,” not Islamic militants.

headline.main: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks
headline.print_headline: Kenyan Leader Blames Domestic Foes, Not Shabab, for Attacks
